title: Estimated U.S. retail per capita sales from 2000 to 2017
yAxis: Per capita sales in U.S. dollars
summary: In general Per capita sales in U.S. dollars has stayed the same over the Year.
Per capita sales in U.S. dollars is roughly constant from 2007 to 2008, slightly decreasing from 2008 to 2009, and lastly slightly increasing from 2009 to 2012.
The most drastic decrease took place within the Year 2008 and 2009.
The highest Per capita sales in U.S. dollars, of value 13702.0 was reached at Year 2012
The lowest Per capita sales in U.S. dollars, of value 11776.0 was reported at Year 2009
